Preline UI is an open-source set of prebuilt UI components based on the utility-first CSS framework, Tailwind CSS. It offers a range of customizable components and interactive elements designed to accelerate web development.

Use Preline UI when you want to quickly build web interfaces with Tailwind CSS and need a set of pre-designed components to speed up the development process. It's suitable for projects where you want to leverage the flexibility of Tailwind CSS with ready-to-use UI elements.

Avoid Preline UI if you require a component library with extensive built-in theming capabilities or highly customized designs that deviate significantly from the default Preline UI styles. Also, be mindful of the dependency size and potential maintenance overhead associated with third-party dependencies.
Preline is framework agnostic and works everywhere
Preline has 77 Components, 66 of them are unique – for example pagination and button group are considered as same.
Preline has light and dark themes
Does not support more than 2 themes at the same time
Preline CSS file is available on CDN
Preline does not use semantic CSS class names. Using semantic and descriptive CSS class names improves readability and maintainability of code independent of the current framework.
Preline requires changing class names one by one at build time to do customization
Preline does not provide micro CSS files for each component
Preline uses wide-gamut P3 colors by default
Preline customizations requires changing Tailwind CSS class names at build time
Preline doesn not use native CSS nesting

daisyUI is a component library for Tailwind CSS that provides pre-designed components with theming capabilities. It is framework-agnostic, meaning it can be used in any web project, and it doesn't ship any JavaScript to the browser.

Use daisyUI when you want to rapidly prototype or build a project with a consistent design system based on Tailwind CSS. It's well-suited for projects where you need a large variety of customizable components and theme options without writing a lot of custom CSS.

Avoid daisyUI if you need highly specific or unique component designs that deviate significantly from the pre-designed styles. Also, if you prefer to build all components from scratch for maximum control over every detail, daisyUI might not be the best choice.
daisyUI is framework agnostic and works everywhere
daisyUI has 63 components, 59 of them are unique – for example pagination and button group are considered as same.
daisyUI supports unlimited themes at the same time, allowing for dynamic theme switching.
daisyUI doesn't ship JavaScript to browsers
daisyUI has no dependencies. It's immune to 3rd party vulnerabilities, dependency version mismatch, and deprecation issues.
In GitHub's top 400 repositories of all time
daisyUI CSS file is available on CDN
daisyUI uses semantic CSS class names. Using semantic and descriptive CSS class names improves readability and maintainability of code independent of the current framework.
daisyUI provides tokens, root-level CSS variables and component-level CSS variables that let you adjust colors, sizes, spacing, radius, and other styles to match your design.
daisyUI can be used as a standalone file, with Tailwind CSS standalone version. This is useful for projects without a Node.js environment.
daisyUI provides micro CSS files for each component
daisyUI uses CSS variables for design customization at runtime
daisyUI uses native CSS nesting, reducing the CSS file size
Why some developers choose daisyUI when they also use Preline UI

Many developers show their support for Preline UI on GitHub. daisyUI has received more stars, indicating strong community engagement. daisyUI includes a wide set of components covering many common UI needs. daisyUI works without needing any other external JavaScript or CSS libraries
daisyUI provides 35 themes compared to Preline UI's 2. This wider selection can help find a design that fits your project faster.

Many developers show their support for Preline UI on GitHub. daisyUI has received more stars, indicating strong community engagement. Many projects use Preline UI. Statistics show more projects install daisyUI than Preline UI weekly
Many developers show their support for Preline UI on GitHub. daisyUI has received more stars, indicating strong community engagement.
Many projects use Preline UI. Statistics show more projects install daisyUI than Preline UI weekly.
daisyUI includes a wide set of components covering many common UI needs.
daisyUI works without needing any other external JavaScript or CSS libraries.
Many developers find daisyUI useful because it works with any JavaScript framework, or even without one. Preline UI is often tied to specific frameworks like ALL.
